intro: Tagetes flosculosa, commonly known as the Mexican marigold or narrowleaf marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, linear leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. The flowers are not only ornamental but also have historical uses in traditional medicine and as a natural pest repellent.
